discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is "B"

Selected Answer: B
The answer is B.

Answer A: Encapsulation dot1Q 200 -> this will apply to VLAN 200. We need 100. So it can't be the correct answer.
Answer C: Again references the wrong VLAN in the encapsulation command.
Answer D: policy-map is call shape_GigabitEthernet4.200, but it applies shape_Gigabit Ethernet4.100 on the interface, which as far as we know doesn't exist.

Answer B has no errors in it. The policy-map is called shape_Gigabit Ethernet4.200 which is fine, as it can be called anything, doesn't have to have the correct interface name in it, and it is applied correctly to the interface.
Option D is the correct answer

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer is configuring a QoS policy to shape traffic for VLAN 100 on a subinterface. Which policy configuration accomplishes the task?
Which Cisco SD-WAN feature propagates packets with SGTs through the network?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct. 
If hardware does not support SGT propagation through inline tagging, you can propagate SGT using SXP.

Selected Answer: B
SGT can be propagated either via Inline Tagging or SXP.

I would say answer is B, as it is MORE correct. Using SXP is a back-up option, and can't be configured natively in a vManage template.

choices.B: querying a device and aggregating statistics

questions.question_text: Which two REST API functions are performed for Cisco devices in an overlay network? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Official Cisco documentation, literally lists A and B on the front page.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
Control connections might not come up if the overlay network has routing issues. If this is the case, the State column in the show control connections command output has a value of "connect", which indicates that a connection attempt is in progress. If the control connection is up, the State column shows a value of "up".

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer is troubleshooting a control connection issue. What does `connect` mean in this show control connections output?

choices.C: Control connection attempt is in progress
Ensure that traffic is sent through a GRE tunnel
choices.A: Ensure that routing is symmetric between locations.
choices.B: Disable shaping in the queue assigned for the application.
choices.D: Create a DRE feature template in vManage

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A.

First comment under 'Restrictions for DRE' -> DRE is a dual-side solution. Therefore, flow symmetry is required to configure DRE optimization. DRE isnâ€™t supported for asymmetric flows.
